node.statement: Case (a) Vanishing for m_n > c(pi): When m_n > c(pi), the additive character x -> psi(Q varpi^{m_n} x) has conductor p^{c(pi)-m_n}, which is contained in p (since c(pi)-m_n < 0). Hence psi(Q varpi^{m_n} x) is trivial for all x in o. Since k_{nn} in o for k in K_n, the twist psi^{-1}(Q varpi^{m_n} k_{nn}) = 1 for all k in K_n. The K-integral becomes J_K(m) = int_{K_n} V^circ(ak) dk. This equals the K_n-average of the right translate of V^circ, i.e., the projection of V^circ onto the space of right-K_n-invariant functions. For ramified pi with c(pi) >= 1, the conductor exponent is the minimal c >= 0 such that pi^{K_1(p^c)} is nonzero. Since c(pi) >= 1, we have pi^{K_n} = pi^{K_1(p^0)} = 0 (the zero subspace). Therefore the K_n-average of any vector in W(pi, psi), including V^circ, vanishes: int_{K_n} V^circ(ak) dk = 0 for all a. Hence J_K(m) = 0 when m_n > c(pi).
